entry.title: Exploring Notification Options in S/4 HANA Public Cloud for Centralized User Communications
entry.content:
I'm reaching out to gather insights regarding an initiative we're undertaking for a client. They are eager to implement a centralized system for disseminating important information to their end users, such as process changes, updates, and downtime notifications.

Our initial thought was to leverage the notification service within the Launchpad for this purpose. However, it appears that the options for sending custom notifications in the SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition might be limited

With this in mind, I've been exploring alternative solutions and came across the possibility of using Situation Handling as a potential workaround for posting notifications. My understanding is somewhat limited, and I've noticed a lack of comprehensive documentation on integrating situation handling with custom business objects

I would greatly appreciate any advice, experiences, or insights you could share on this matter. Specifically, is it feasible to create a situation object linked to a custom business object for this purpose? Or are there other strategies within the S/4 HANA ecosystem that you would recommend for achieving centralized communication with end users?

Thanks in advance.

entry.title: Custom Situation Handling Object: Creation Not Allowed via ADT
entry.content:
Hi All,

On S/4HANA Public Cloud: Has anyone successfully created a Custom Situation Object via ADT and completely integrated it to a scenario, to receive an alert based on a situation?

I had written to SAP in Dec 2022 & in Jun 2023 via OSS messages to understand how can that be done and at both times, I received message back saying all the components required to make this work is not yet released.

Now, even after 2048 upgrade (and 18 months after my last OSS message to SAP), still the Situation is no different. When I try to built a custom situation object via ADT, I still do not have authorization to do that (eventhough I have complete development access to the tenant)

The interfaces required to have an event based trigger is not yet released. Interfaces required for defining callback classes are also not released. Thus, custom classes cannot be defined for any of the actions or triggers.

The only way I have managed to create a custom situation object is via Key User Extensibility, referencing a custom CDS view.

SAP had published the tutorial and examples for creation of custom situation object via ADT, long time ago (https://help.sap.com/docs/abap-cloud/abap-development-tools-user-guide/creating-situation-objects?version=s4hana_cloud) and messages like this, this & this from SAP employees, seem to indicate that whatever is required to build the solution is all delivered by SAP.

So, what am I missing here? Has SAP delivered this functionality at all for S/4HANA on Cloud (or ABAP on Cloud) as per their training/documentation?

If yes, what is still needed in developer roles to avoid the error? If no, when is this functionality expected to be fully released?

Cc: @ana_goncalves @angelika_salmen 

Thanks

entry.title: Budget Threshold Alerts for Cost Centers
entry.content:
Hello SAP Community,

We are using SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition and have enabled budget availability control for cost centers. and are wondering if there is any way to set up budget threshold alerting for cost center budgets.

Specifically, we would like to send an email to the cost center responsible (as assigned in the cost center master data) when the budget threshold is nearing 75%, so they do not have to regularly check the Cost Center Budget Report (F3871).

I know that with project budgets, this can be easily done using a predefined situation handling template (EPPM_PROJBUDGETTHRESHOLDEXCEEDED). However, I couldn't find anything similar for cost centers. Does anyone know how this can be achieved with reasonable effort?

Thank you for your help!

Best regards,
Simon

entry.title: Fiori Push Notification with Situations handling or with another Notification provider?
entry.content:
Hello Experts,

In S/4Hana 2023 we want to trigger a push Notification

  • when an order of a specific order type is newly created
  • to specific users (can be determined from a custom CDS view)
  • on a mobile device or Fiori Shell bar
  • without doing a (bigger) development, just config

 How to implement this?

 Option 1: Situations Handling

There seems to be no standard framework available to cover this, so it seems we need to use the extended framework of situations handling. Can the requirements be fulfilled with the extended framework of situation handling?

Option 2: Workflow

Using Workflow and then the Notification provider SAP_BUSINESS_WORKFLOW would probably work. But then we’d need a developer with workflow skills, which we don’t have.

 Option 3: Other notification providers?

Can we use instead of Situations Handling or Workflow another notification provider (/IWNGW/BEP_NPREG) which is already available? I can find in S/4H2023 FP02 around 88 notification providers. Are there other notification providers with which my scenario can be fulfilled and without doing a bigger development?

I’m wondering e.g. if following provider would be helpful?

SAP_FIORI_REFERENCE_APPS    CL_SEPMRA_NOTIF_PROVIDER

Thanks in advance!

entry.title: Extended situation handling issues on SAP S/4HANA 2023 FPS03 ?
entry.content:
Hello Dear Expert,

I’m currently facing some issues while configuring Situation Handling for parked accounting documents — specifically, when a document is parked using transaction MIR7, I want a notification to be triggered.

I created a custom CDS view that retrieves only parked accounting documents, and here are the different approaches I’ve tested:

1. Object-Based Event – BOR

  • Event Category: BOR Object Type      Event Object: FIPP           Event Type: COMPLETED

  • Result: No instance detected

2. Object-Based Event – ABAP Class

  • Event Category: ABAP Class   Event Object: CL_FINS_JOURNALENTRY_SOT_EVENT  Event Type: CREATED

  • Result: No instance detected

3. Job-Based Trigger

  • Result: Works correctly.
    I receive the notification and the details appear in the "My Situations – Extended" app.

However, I’m still facing two issues:

  • The situation doesn’t appear in the "My Situations" section on the Home screen.

  • The job can only be scheduled every 3 hours, not more frequently.

My questions:

  1. In the case of Event-based triggers, which event should I choose? Why does it say "No instance detected"?

  2. Why is the notification shown only in the Inbox icon, but not in the "My Situations" section on the Home screen?

  3. With Job-based triggers, how can I schedule the job to run every 5 minutes instead of every 3 hours?

Thanks in advance.

Mben!
